Contact Legislators Now

{include "default_salutation"} –

This is an urgent request. This week is our last chance before February 2022 to let the Oregon Legislature know that we haven't forgotten about the racist impact of non-unanimous juries on our state.

You can help by sending a letter to demand justice for all those sitting in prison because of a racist and unconstitutional non-unanimous jury to seek a retrial if they choose.

Right now, hundreds of people in Oregon are sitting in prison during a pandemic even though up to two jurors voted "not guilty" in their cases. These are called non-unanimous juries, and they were designed to silence jurors so a white majority could convict whomever they wanted.

Black people are only 2.2% of Oregon's state population yet are estimated to comprise at least 16% of those convicted by non-unanimous juries. Unfortunately, this means Black people continue to bear the brunt of the consequences of non-unanimous juries.

Even though the Supreme Court of the United States decided in 2020 that non-unanimous juries are unconstitutional, hundreds still remain in prison because of the date of their conviction.

It is now more crucial than ever that we push the Oregon Legislature to action. Send a letter today to the Oregon Legislature and demand they support legislation that allows people impacted by non-unanimous juries to seek a retrial.

In solidarity,
